text: Tinda (), also called "Indian squash", "round melon", "Indian round gourd", "apple gourd" or "Indian baby pumpkin", is a squash-like cucurbit grown for its immature fruit. The fruit is a vegetable that is especially popular in Southern Asia. It is NOT the "National vegetable of India". ==References== Category:National symbols of India Category:Plants of Asia Category:Cucurbitaceae
title: Tinda
